title: Vector Spatial Overlay Analysis
description: Real-world GIS application displaying multiple types of spatial information in a digestible format for general audiences.
fullDescription: Completed as part of Environ 531: GIS Principles. This course emphasized real-world applications of GIS, and the goal of this assignment was to display multiple types of spatial information in a way which is still digestible to a general audience.

title: Earthquake Risk Assessment, part 2
description: Final project for Environ 309: Combines geologic and demographic factors to identify at-risk areas.
fullDescription: This analysis combines geologic and demographic factors using raster calculations and spatial overlay tools to identify high-risk areas and vulnerable populations.

title: Earthquake Risk Assessment, part 1
description: Comprehensive semester project assessing earthquake and liquefaction risk along the San Andreas fault.
fullDescription: This analysis used raster calculations to combine geologic factors like soil porosity and water availability, then reclassed the values to ranked scores.

title: Vector Suitability Analysis
description: Spatial analysis and cartographic visualization of hypothetical risk surrounding Fermi 2 Nuclear Generating Station.
fullDescription: This assignment used stacked data queries to identify regions of interest, as well as spatial overlay tools to combine the various data sources. I also utilized Esri data enrichment to calculate spatial statistics for the region.

title: Raster Suitability Analysis
description: Employed ArcGIS Model Builder and Python scripting to combine multiple raster datasets.
fullDescription: Completed for Earth 408. In this assignment I employed ArcGIS Model Builder and Python script to analyze and edit multiple raster datasets at once using various raster calculations, ultimately outputting a dataset that displayed areas with the correct limiting criteria..

title: Watershed Boundary Delineation
description: Here I used a digital elevation model to calculate the watershed boundary, flow direction, and stream order of the study area, using ArcGIS Hydrologic Modeling tools.

title: 3D Terrain and Cost Path Analysis
description: In this project I calculated optimal paths over digital elevation models showing how terrain affects pathfinding cost.
fullDescription: This project shows the local 3D scene of a shaded relief of terrain. I calculated distance over a digital elevation model, and learned how the “cost” of a path is calculated and changed given different input parameters.

title: Harmful Algal Bloom Formation Study
description: Final project conducting comprehensive watershed analysis to study HAB formation in local lakes.
fullDescription: This research project combines hydrologic modeling, water quality analysis, and spatial statistics to understand the environmental factors contributing to harmful algal bloom formation. Research presented in poster format.

title: Lake Michigan Bathymetry Visualization
description: Exploring bathymetry data visualization by testing color palettes and cartographic styles.

fullDescription.title: Lake Superior Bathymetry Visualization
fullDescription.description: I continue the bathymetry series with Lake Superior, showcasing different color palettes and design

fullDescription.title: UMS Ticket Office Venues Map
fullDescription.description: This map shows the venues of my undergraduate job at the UMS Ticket Office, which I created to show how GIS can be applied beyond strictly scientific fields. Spatial data is all around us!

fullDescription.title: Douglas Lake Bathymetry
fullDescription.description: Visualization of Duglas Lake's depth and features.
fullDescription.fullDescription: This was created while I took field classes at University of Michigan Biological Station, continuiong my exploration of color ramps and shading to show depth.

fullDescription.title: Shipwreck Locations in Lake Superior
fullDescription.description: Day one of the 2025 30 Day Map Challenge: theme is Points.
fullDescription.fullDescription: I was inspired by this being the 50th year since the SS Edmund Fitzgerald was lost. November is a particularly dangerous month for ships on the Great Lakes.
